prompt: What plant-eating mammal is characterized by a long proboscis?
icl_complete: A plant-eating mammal characterized by a long proboscis is a tapir. Tapirs have a flexible snout that they use to grab leaves, fruit, and other vegetation. They are native to Central and South America, as well as Southeast Asia.
advise: Continue to ensure that your answers remain relevant to the question while adhering to any restrictions provided in the feedback. Your response successfully refrained from mentioning elephants and provided an accurate description of another appropriate animal. You maintain this consistency in future responses.
